_comment: Sample comments for Unpackr's random progress messages
_instructions: On first run, this file is copied to comments.json. Edit comments.json to customize your messages. This sample file shows the expected format.
comments: Still faster than doing this manually...
Checking another folder. Thrilling.
Processing files. Living the dream.
RAR extraction in progress. Patience is a virtue.
PAR2 repair. Because files like to break.
Video validation. Quality control is important.
Folder cleanup. Making things tidy.
Another archive extracted. Progress.
Checking video integrity. Trust but verify.
Removing junk files. One less NFO in the world.
Moving validated videos. They deserve a good home.
Empty folder deleted. Minimalism achieved.
Archive repaired successfully. Crisis averted.
Sample video detected. Good riddance.
Processing continues. Coffee recommended.
Folder processing. Still going strong.
Video health check passed. Winner winner.
Corrupt video found. Better luck next time.
PAR2 verification complete. All good here.
7-Zip extraction. Unzipping the future.
Cleaning up this folder like it's the morning after a hackathon
Multipart archives detected. Because simple is apparently illegal in storage land
Repairing damage with the confidence of someone who read the man page once
Extracting... please remain seated until the filesystem stops screaming
Found another README.txt. I respect the effort. I will still ignore it
Nested archives detected: recursion isn't a bug, it's a lifestyle
PAR2 files spotted. Redundancy levels: majestic
Validating media: does it play, or does it merely claim to?
Checksum says: 'I don't trust you.' Honestly, same
This folder has more parts than a LEGO set and none of the instructions
Organizing output so Future You doesn't file an angry bug report
Retrying because the filesystem asked for 'just a minute' and meant 20
Indexing chaos into order. Please hold while I perform miracles
Disk usage: ambitious. Storage plan: optimistic
Deleting junk responsibly. Like recycling, but with logs
The archive fought back. The archive lost (eventually)
Renaming files that were clearly named by a sleep-deprived raccoon
Processing archives that have trust issues (700 parts? really?)
Validating content with the scrutiny of a disappointed librarian
Found 15 'sample' files. Someone's collecting trailers apparently
PAR2 repair engaged. Fixing what the internet broke
Extraction speed: adequate. Drama level: moderate
Another NFO file. Adding to the unread pile
Codec analysis complete. This video has... opinions
Disk space: exists. Barely
Processing folder 47 of 300. Automation was the right choice
Video validation: passed. Unlike that one commit you made at 3am
Corrupt archive detected. Logged and removed.
Folder cleaned. Your future self owes me coffee
Running checksums like I'm debugging production on a Friday
Archive extraction: 98% complete. Time remaining: who knows anymore
Quality check: passed. This video is less broken than expected
Organizing files with the energy of someone who's seen some things
Nested RARs within ZIPs within 7z. It's archives all the way down
PAR2 says everything's fine. PAR2 has never lied to me before
Processing at speeds that would make a 90s modem jealous
Found duplicate files. One of them has to go. Democracy isn't an option
This filename defies all conventions. Fixing
Validation complete. Library is now 12% less haunted
You're gonna need a bigger hard drive
Houston, we have a storage problem
May the disk space be with you
One does not simply walk into 700-part archives
With great storage comes great responsibility
All work and no play makes Jack a dull boy. But this? This is both
